info.name: Olivocerebellar tract
info.description: The olivocerebellar tract originates in the inferior olivary nuclei with its axons decussating within the medulla to enter the contralateral cerebellum via the inferior cerebellar peduncle.  The axons in this tract terminate as climbing fibers within the cerebellum.  Note that as these nerve fibers cross the medulla, they are sometimes referred to as internal arcuate fibers; these should not be confused with the internal arcuate fibers that originate in the dorsal column nuclei and decussate to form the medial lemniscus.
